intro: Micropterum herrei, commonly known as the Hawaiian fern tree, is a unique species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its large, compound leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional Hawaiian practices, and it plays an important ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected in conservation efforts.
